page.title: 03 New Forest edge of Wellow.
page.content: The land is flat and low lying.At Salisbury Lodge there is a field for geese and an oak lined road.There is a deciduous copse and a hay field. Opposite a potato field there is a field of sheep and one of wheat.Here the soil is a thin clay.On the same soil there are small fields of cabbaqe lined by deciduous trees followed by fenced grazing land.An oil pipeline from the refinery at Fawley is being laid to take oil to the Midlands.The soil changes here to silver sand and the land though still low lying is more undulating.On all sides there are Silver Birch trees and Scots Pine with heather and bracken.Forest ponies are here. by Samantha Deane,Alex Watkins,Lucy Burroughs,Julie Bright,Sarah Croucher, Elizabeth Eames,Patricia Ruddy.
